results.title: The Spy who loved me (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Albert R. Broccoli, United Artists Corporation, Lewis Gilbert and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: The Spy who loved me was the third performance by Roger Moore as James Bond, British secret service agent 007. In this instalment Bond is sent to foil Karl Stromberg - a megalomaniac villain who steals the plans to a nuclear tracking device that will allow him to control missiles and rule the world. Bond is sent to Cairo and teams with sexy Russian agent Anya Amasova (Barbara Bach), fending off seductive women and murderous men, in an attempt to retrieve the microfilm. Famous sequences include the pre-credits ski hill chase and a thrilling pursuit through Cairo that turns into an underwater adventure thanks to some deft British technology. Stromberg’s underwater headquarters make an impressive set piece, and provides ample opportunities for him to feed enemies to man-eating sharks. Richard Kiel stars as Jaws - a memorably gruesome Bond enemy with menacing metal choppers for weaponry. This Bond is replete with impressive stunts, action sequences and wisecracks from the wry lady’s man, but is less campy than its predecessors, “Live and let die” and “The Man with the golden gun”, both of which starred Moore.

results.title: The Spongers
results.creator_credit: Tony Garnett, British Broadcasting Corporation and Roland Joffe
results.brief_description: A play written by Jim Allen and set during the 1977 Silver Jubilee. Britain seems to be in a state of rejoicing, and there seems to be plenty of money to spend on the festivities, but Pauline has nothing to cheer about. She has four children, the eldest is a Downs Syndrome child, she has no income and because of the family cannot go out to work. In theory the social service exists to help those in such situations. In practice there are tribunals, councils and welfare departments to be faced.

results.title: The Siege of Pinchgut
results.creator_credit: Harry Watt, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description: Made in Australia by Ealing Studios, this film is concerned with the escape from prison of a man who claims he has been unjustly incarcerated. He escapes and lands on Pinchgut Island in Sydney Harbour, occupies a disused arsenal and defies a police seige by taking the caretaker and his family hostage. Stars Aldo Ray and Heather Sears with Richard Vernon, Grant Taylor and Kenneth Warren. Screenplay by Harry Watt and Jon Cleary.

results.title: The Shout
results.creator_credit: Jerzy Skolimowski, Jeremy Thomas and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description: Alan Bates gives an eery performance in this twisted tale of mind control, primitive power and the dark side of the soul. Bates plays a tramp-like figure named Crossley who claims to have spent many years with the Australian Aboriginals learning their ancient magic and claims to have learnt the power to kill with a shout. The film is a tale by Crossley during a cricket match in an insane asylum. The story centres on Crossley’s meeting with a seemingly loving young couple, he (John Hurt) a successful composer and she (Susannah York) a dedicated nurse in a small village. Crossley seduces the wife and in the process gains an ever increasing power over the couple. With a gripping ending that will have you on the edge of your seat, this is an intriguing film which questions the definition of madness.

results.title: The Shining
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kubrick and Producer Circle Company
results.brief_description: In Stanley Kubrick’s chilling adaptation of a Stephen King horror novel, Jack Torrance, a struggling writer, accepts a job as caretaker of the Overlook Hotel, a luxurious but remote resort with a macabre history of violence. The hotel is closed for the winter, and Jack, his wife, Wendy, and son, Danny, will be the only residents for several snowy months. Jack hopes that the solitude will give him a chance to focus on his writing, but he soon spirals helplessly towards madness and murder as the hotel’s power plays upon his weaknesses. Cast includes: Jack Nicholson, Shelley Duvall, Scatman Crothers and Danny Lloyd.

results.title: The Shawshank redemption (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Frank Darabont, Niki Marvin and Castle Rock Entertainment
results.brief_description: An unforgettable story of hope, friendship and survival inside a maximum security gaol. Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins), a New England banker convicted of murdering his wife and her lover, is sent to Shawshank State Prison where he meets “Red” Redding (Morgan Freeman), a seasoned lifer. Despite twenty years on the inside, the prison bars fail to contain their spirits and the pair forge an unlikely friendship that overcomes pain, suffering and ultimately leads to a chance at freedom.

results.title: The Secret of Roan Inish
results.creator_credit: John Sayles, Maggie Renzi, Sarah Green and Peter Newman Productions
results.brief_description: The Coneelly family, now living on the isolated west coast of Ireland, has been displaced from Roan Inish, the small, mysterious island which they shared with herds of seals. Fiona is sent to live there with her grandparents and becomes determined to penetrate the secrets of her family’s mysterious past and the legends they all embrace. Cast includes Mick Lally, Eileen Colgan, John Lynch and Jeni Courtney.

results.title: The Searchers
results.creator_credit: John Ford, Merian C. Cooper and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Ethan Edwards (John Wayne) resolves to find his niece, abducted by Indians at the close of the Civil War. It is an odyssey which takes five years, by the end of which he plans to take revenge on the Indians for the friends and family he has lost. John Ford used sumptuous Monument Valley as a background for this his most poetic and complex western. Stars Vera Miles and a young Natalie Wood. Based on a novel by Alan Le May.

results.title: The Saviour
results.creator_credit: Stuart Parkyn, Peter Templeman and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Malcolm is a gentle, effective door-to-door evangelist who is in love with a married woman. With pressure mounting from his church to convert her, Malcolm decides his bible is the very weapon he needs to destroy the marriage that is keeping him from his true love. Grand Jury Prize for Best Narrative Short, Slamdance Film Festvial, Park City, USA, 2006
Cast includes Thomas Campbell, Susan Prior, David Somerville, Rhys Muldoon, Nicholas Hammond.
